title: Last Coach Charged in Varsity Blues College Admissions Case Heads to Trial
sub_head: Former USC water polo coach is among the last defendants in case that also snared coaches at Stanford, Yale and Georgetown
body:
BOSTONâ€”The sprawling college admissions cheating scandal that resulted in 50 guilty pleas over nearly three years will tie up one of its last loose ends this week: Acclaimed water polo coach Jovan Vavic is scheduled to go to trial on charges he took bribes in exchange for tagging applicants as recruited athletes.
The trial is likely to provide another glimpse at how the largest education scam ever prosecuted by the Justice Department exploited low-profile college sports and the special advantage given to athletes in the admissions process. The trial, which is expected to last about four weeks, will also put a spotlight on the inner workings of the University of Southern California, where prosecutors said the fraud ran particularly deep.
